image.altText: Police and officials in front of a barricade holding back protesters.

items.synopsis: Donald Trump has arrived in Washington after being indicted on charges related to his conduct in the 2020 presidential election. Follow our live updates.

title.children: Trump faces 2020 election interference charges in Washington DC

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The ABC's North America correspondent Barbara Miller is on the ground as things prepare to get underway. She says today's hearing is expected to be reasonably short. Barbara: Possibly only around half an hour in total and we expect him to be asked to enter a plea to the four charges he's facing. On the way here Donald Trump's been on his social media quite a lot as he travelled form his New Jersey golf club here to DC.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: What to expect from Trump's court appearance in DC

children.content: is on the ground as things prepare to get underway.
She says today's hearing is expected to be reasonably short.

mediaThumbnail.caption: ABC reporter Barbara Miller explains the charges Trump is facing and describes the scenes outside the DC courthouse where his arraignment will take place.

contextSettings.channel.description: Trusted and independent source of local, national and world news. In-depth analysis, business, sport, weather and more.

titleAlt.lg: What to expect from Trump's court appearance in DC today

children.content: Possibly only around half an hour in total and we expect him to be asked to enter a plea to the four charges he's facing.
On the way here Donald Trump's been on his social media quite a lot as he travelled form his New Jersey golf club here to DC.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Our reporter Jade Macmillan says the former president has a pile of papers in front of him, and appears to be sitting in between two of his lawyers. Donald Trump is sitting at a wooden table, whispering to one of his lawyers and appearing to glance around the room. Mr Trump is mostly sitting with his hands clasped together. Reporters in the media room cannot currently hear any sounds from the live TV feed.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Donald Trump has entered court

children.content: Our reporter Jade Macmillan says the former president has a pile of papers in front of him, and appears to be sitting in between two of his lawyers.
Donald Trump is sitting at a wooden table, whispering to one of his lawyers and appearing to glance around the room.
Mr Trump is mostly sitting with his hands clasped together.
Reporters in the media room cannot currently hear any sounds from the live TV feed.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Our reporter Jade Macmillan says US Special Counsel Jack Smith has just been seen entering the courtroom.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: US Special Counsel Jack Smith enters court

children.content: Our reporter Jade Macmillan says US Special Counsel Jack Smith has just been seen entering the courtroom.
US Special Counsel Jack Smith arrives at court.

image.altText: Child's hand clasping adult male finger, close up.

items.synopsis: A Supreme Court judge sentencing a childcare worker for persistent sexual abuse says his four-year old victim may have helped save others when she disclosed his actions to her parents.

title.children: 'Immeasurably harmed': Ex-childcare worker jailed over abuse of 4-year-old girl

image.altText: Michael and Angel stand proudly in front of their new home

items.synopsis: Housework isn't something many people celebrate, but for war veteran Michael Reardon, it's symbolic of something much bigger having a home. His is a good storyamid a housing crisis in his state.

title.children: Last winter Michael was in a caravan, now he has a place he can call home and it has 'changed everything'

image.altText: A black greyhound lying on shredded paper looks up at a camera

items.synopsis: Video of dogs in allegedly sub-standard enclosures,dead marsupials and a horse'shead on the property of a leading greyhound trainer prompts an investigation by Tasmanian authorities.

title.children: Tasmania's leading greyhound trainer under investigation following release of graphic video footage

items.synopsis: A senator challenges why AFP Commissioner Reece Kershaw did not disclose his friendship with a senior PwC partner while designing a contractwith the firm, as SMS exchanges show plans to catch up over a beer, jokes and references to leaks.

title.children: SMS exchanges between AFP commissioner and PwC 'mate' revealed, as top cop faces questions over conflict of interest

image.altText: Illustration showing six B-52 bombers, stylized with American flags, flying over a map of Australia.

items.synopsis: A new US Air Force will build a "mission planning" and operations centre in Darwin, as part of $630 million in American spending across the top end over the next two to three years.

title.children: US Air Force 'mission planning' centre to be built in Nothern Territory

image.altText: A huge 1970s apartment building, with white balconies, many of which feature lush gardens

items.synopsis: Viennais often pointed to as a Western city that is getting its housing strategyright. So how do they do it?

title.children: 'Our rent is significantly lower.' The European city where most people live in social housing

image.altText: Three Chinese police officers outside a court building.

items.synopsis: The ABC can reveal a "contact point" linked to police in a Chinese city has gone online and remains operational in Australia. Similar operations have been investigated by US authorities for espionage, but Australian authorities remain unconcerned.

title.children: China's overseas police 'contact point' joins the cloud and remains operational in Australia

image.altText: Pop singer Lizzo appears on stage.

items.synopsis: Grammy-winning pop star Lizzo labelsclaims of sexual harassment made against her by former dancers "false" and "outrageous".

title.children: 'Too outrageous to not be addressed': Lizzo responds to sexual harassment lawsuit

image.altText: patches of snow on grass with ski lifts overhead

items.synopsis: Unseasonable warmthhas been persistent across much of Australia for weeks, but intensified temperatures and unusual heat are becoming more regular.

title.children: Australia thaws in mid-winter warmth  is winter over?

image.altText: Anthony Albaneselooks out to the audience, he wears a yellow tie with a suit

items.synopsis: The Voice debate has become far more complex than Anthony Albanese would have wanted it to be but his government is at risk of letting down the 'yes vote' by being too cautious, writes Michelle Grattan.

title.children: Albanese is trying to builda solid fence around the Voice debate. It's not working

image.altText: A parent reads out loud to a child

items.synopsis: Less than half of Australian parents and guardians are open with their kids about consent and their body. It could be part of the reason why child sex abuse victims stay silent.

title.children: 'Shame, self-blame, threats': Why child sex abuse victims don't speak up, and what parents can do to help

image.altText: google map of southern QLD

items.synopsis: An ecologist says it is likelyfire ants are already in NSWand if they get into grain-growing regions they willspread quickly.So, how can they be stopped?

title.children: Lessons from Queensland's 'struggling' eradication program as fire ants tipped to spread

image.altText: Hanane Ait El Haj and Fatima Tagnaout smile lying down

items.synopsis: Germany, two-time champions and number two-ranked side are out, but Morocco's Atlas Lionesses are dreaming of further success after victory against Colombia.

title.children: Five quick hits  Germany's pain may be Matildas' gain

image.altText: Two people wearing red holding a black banner with text and a two storey house draped in black cloth behind them

items.synopsis: Police make multiple arrests after the five-hour protest against new oil and gas projectsat Rishi Sunak's Yorkshire property, prompting calls for investigations into security breach.

title.children: Protesters arrested after climbing atop UK PM's mansion and covering it in black fabric

image.altText: The Ares 1-X test rocket lifts off from Kennedy Space Centre

items.synopsis: Australia's space industry is warning the sector is "in limbo" and facing an uncertain future after the axing of several key space programs.

title.children: Australia's space industry 'in limbo' after key programs axed

image.altText: Policemen examine a crime scene inside

items.synopsis: An attack south of Seoul leaves one person dead and several others injured as police call it "virtually an act of terorism".

title.children: One dead, 12 injured in stabbing, ramming attack in South Korea

image.altText: A large set of drones is pictured inside a big warehouse-like space.

items.synopsis: Iranian-made drones loaded with explosives leave a trail of destruction in Ukraine. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: How Iranian-made kamikaze drones became part of Russia's arsenal in its war with Ukraine

image.altText: The face of this year's Jeans for Genes campaign, Archer Brady happily poses in jeans, a blue shirt against a blue background.

items.synopsis: Archer Brady's family has along associationwith Jeans for Genes Day. It wasn't until he was diagnosed with cystic fibrosis that it became personal.

title.children: Archer's doctor says his genetic condition means he can have all the junk food he wants

image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of Victoria.

items.synopsis: Police allege Troy Maskellthrew a one-litre bottle of sports drink that struck John Burke in the head at a Victorian petrol station in 2021.

title.children: Man accused of causing 73yo's death by throwing sports drink on trial in Victoria's Supreme Court

image.altText: A photo of Travis King in army uniform, standing in front of an American flag. He is a black man  in his 20s with dark eyes.

items.synopsis: North Korea acknowledges that it has in custody a US soldier that dashed over the heavily-guarded border with South Korea last month.

title.children: North Korea acknowledges it has US soldier who ran across demilitarised zone

image.altText: John Daun pictured in an aged care facility.

items.synopsis: Melissa Daun says for the two years her father lived at Southern Cross Care's aged care home in South Hobart it felt like "banging your head against a wall".

title.children: Melissa got a sympathy card from her father's aged care home after he died. She sent it back

image.altText: Photos of Captain Danniel Lyon,Lieutenant Max Nugent,Warrant Officer Class Two Joseph Laycock andCorporal Alexander Naggs

items.synopsis: Australian Defence Force Chief of Joint Operations Lieutenant General Greg Bilton says underwater searches for the MRH90 Taipan has found further debris including parts of the cockpit and human remains.

title.children: Human remains found near Taipan helicopter wreckage

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair and glasses speaking a lecturn in front of an australian flag

items.synopsis: The Liberal senator launches legal action in the WA Supreme Courtagainst Brittany Higgins,allegingtwo social media postsdefamed her.

title.children: Senator Linda Reynolds sues Brittany Higgins for defamation over social media posts

image.altText: Shane walks along carrying documents and wearing sunglasses.

items.synopsis: The board of inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann over the alleged rape of Brittany Higgins was sparked by allegations made by ACTDirector of Public Prosecutions Shane Drumgold against police. But its final report has found those allegations were "incorrect" and "without any rational basis".

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann inquiry report accuses man who prosecuted the case of 'knowingly lying' to chief justice

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a black hoodie

items.synopsis: Brett Andrew Button will face a total of63 offences next week, after a bus crash in June in which 10 people died.

title.children: Hunter Valley bus crash driver to face 43 additional charges

image.altText: Hawthorn Hawks signage at the clubs headquarters in Melbourne.

items.synopsis: The author of the Hawthorn Football Club cultural safety reviewand former CEO of the Murray Valley Aboriginal Cooperativehas been charged as part ofa Victoria Police investigation into allegedfinancial mismanagement.

title.children: Hawthorn Football Club cultural safety review author Phil Egan charged with fraud-related offences

image.altText: Dayne Zorko is on top of Touk Miller in a screenshot from TV footage of a game

items.synopsis: Gold Coast fume as captain Touk Miller is suspended for one AFL game for conduct unbecoming over his contentious tackle on Brisbane rival Dayne Zorko.

title.children: Suns unhappy as Miller receives belated ban for grabbing Zorko's groin

image.altText: Daniel Tupou dives towards the corner to score a try while Manly defenders look on

items.synopsis: Sydney beat Manly 26-16 at the SCG to dent the Sea Eagles' finals plans, but a strange sending off of Nathan Brown somewhat overshadows the play.

title.children: Roosters survive send off to defeat Manly and keep finals hopes alive

image.altText: A sketch of Benjamin Glenn Hoffmann in court.

items.synopsis: One of the Northern Territory's most well-known murderers has told the Darwin Local Court he feared for his life before allegedly assaulting a fellow prisoner.

title.children: Mass shooter Hoffmann 'feared for life' before alleged prison assault with hot coffee

image.altText: Warren Tredrea

items.synopsis: Channel Nine's Adelaide news director has defended his network's dismissal of former AFL star Warren Tredrea, telling the Federal Court the sports presenter'son-air performancehad failed to improve  despite a glowing 2018 performance reviewdescribinghim as an "excellent ambassador".

title.children: Nine described Tredrea as 'excellent ambassador', unfair dismissal case hears

image.altText: A red car is just showing out of soil and trees which have slipped off a hill on a beach

items.synopsis: A major landslip has buried a car and damaged another at a popular tourist destination. Residents say it is the biggest slip they have seen in the region.

title.children: Drivers 'very lucky' not to be hurt in Rainbow Beach landslip

image.altText: A sandstone building with a dome on top and a porch on the right with green bushes and red flowers in front

items.synopsis: Eight people were wounded in separate shellings onStCatherine's Cathedral in Kherson. It once held the remains of acommander who annexed the Crimean Peninsula 240 years ago.

title.children: Russian shelling damages landmark Ukrainian church that once held 18th-century commander's remains

image.altText: soft focus footage of an AI men with a scruffy beard in a brown hooded clock

items.synopsis: Jesus has been portrayed in many different ways, but no one has called Jesus an internet guru  that is, until now, writesJoseph L. Kimmel.

title.children: Dressed in a hooded brown-and-white robe,'Chatbot Jesus' is here

image.altText: Bulldozers and a police vehicle in a birds eye photo at Newry State Forest

items.synopsis: World Wildlife FundAustralia is urging environmental reforms in NSW after the state ranked lastin its efforts to fight deforestation.

title.children: WWF releases findings on states fighting deforestation. NSW ranked last
